headline.main: GOLD MEDALS FOR HEROINES.; Mrs. Raynor, Mrs. Southard, and Miss Rhodes of Freeport, L. I., Honored.

docs.snippet: BOSTON, Oct. 17. -- The British steamer Cambroman, from Liverpool, which arrived here this afternoon, reports that on Oct. 13, at 5:10 P.M., while in latitude 48 47' north, longitude 48 7' west, she signaled the Anchor Line steamer Ethiopia, Capt....
docs.lead_paragraph: BOSTON, Oct. 17. -- The British steamer Cambroman, from Liverpool, which arrived here this afternoon, reports that on Oct. 13, at 5:10 P.M., while in latitude 48 47' north, longitude 48 7' west, she signaled the Anchor Line steamer Ethiopia, Capt. Boothby, from New-York Oct. 7 for Glasgow, with her shaft broken.

headline.main: ETHIOPIA SIGHTED DISABLED.; The Anchor Liner Bound from New-York to Glasgow Breaks Her Shaft.

docs.snippet: The Captain, first officer, and eight of the crew of the Red Star Liner Noordland were presented yesterday with the medals of the New-York Life-Saving Benevolent Association on account of their recent gallant rescue of the crew of the Norwegian ba...
docs.abstract: Noordland; Medals Presented to Officers for Rescue of Konig Oscar II.'s Crew
docs.lead_paragraph: The Captain, first officer, and eight of the crew of the Red Star Liner Noordland were presented yesterday with the medals of the New-York Life-Saving Benevolent Association on account of their recent gallant rescue of the crew of the Norwegian bark Konig Oscar II. The presentation took place just before noon on board the Noordland, which lay at her pier in Jersey City.

headline.main: REWARDING THE HEROES.; MEDALS TO OFFICERS AND CREW OF THE NOORDLAND.

docs.snippet: The Bed Star Liner Noordland, which yesterday arrived from Antwerp, brought the Captain and crew of the Norwegian bark Konig Oscar II., which was abandoned at sea in a sinking condition....
docs.abstract: Konig Oscar II, Sunk; Crew Rescued by Noordland
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bed Star Liner Noordland, which yesterday arrived from Antwerp, brought the Captain and crew of the Norwegian bark Konig Oscar II., which was abandoned at sea in a sinking condition.

headline.main: THRILLING RESCUE AT SEA.; CREW OF A NORWAY BARK SAVED BY THE NOORDLAND.

docs.snippet: Another sad boating accident occurred last night, resulting in the death of one man and injuries to three other members of the party. The Sound steamer Puritan of the Fall River Line was the cause....
docs.abstract: Pilgrim (Not Puritan) Sinks Fishing Boat in Hell Gate
docs.lead_paragraph: Another sad boating accident occurred last night, resulting in the death of one man and injuries to three other members of the party. The Sound steamer Puritan of the Fall River Line was the cause.

headline.main: RUN DOWN IN HELL GATE; A FISHING BOAT SWAMPED BY THE STEAMER PURITAN. ONE MAN DROWNED, AND THREE HAVE NARROW ESCAPES -- RESCUED BY QUICK-WITTED EDWARD BEHRMAN -- A DANGEROUS PLACE FOR SMALL BOATS TO ANCHOR.

docs.snippet: The ferryboat South Brooklyn of the line plying between New-York and the foot of Thirty-ninth Street, South Brooklyn, had a narrow escape yesterday morning from sinking in midstream with 800 passengers on board....
docs.lead_paragraph: The ferryboat South Brooklyn of the line plying between New-York and the foot of Thirty-ninth Street, South Brooklyn, had a narrow escape yesterday morning from sinking in midstream with 800 passengers on board.

headline.main: IN PERIL IN A FERRYBOAT; THE SOUTH BROOKLYN KNOCKS A HOLE IN HER BOTTOM. SINKS SOON AFTER BEACHING HER DOCK -- SAID TO HAVE STRUCK A ROCK IN BUTTERMILK CHANNEL -- SHE HAD ABOUT EIGHT HUNDRED PASSENGERS ON BOARD.

docs.snippet: CORUNNA, Nov. 16. -- The British gunboat Lapwing brought the Serpent's survivors to Corunna to-day. One of the survivors, named Burton, said that the Serpent struck a covered rock about 10:30 o'clock Monday night, the weather at the time being dir...
docs.abstract: Serpent, British Torpedo Cruiser, Wrecked; Two hundred and Fifty Lost
docs.lead_paragraph: CORUNNA, Nov. 16. -- The British gunboat Lapwing brought the Serpent's survivors to Corunna to-day. One of the survivors, named Burton, said that the Serpent struck a covered rock about 10:30 o'clock Monday night, the weather at the time being dirty, but not foggy. All hands were below, except the officers and six watchmen.

headline.main: THE LOSS OF THE SERPENT.; A SURVIVOR TELLS THE STORY OF THE GREAT DISASTER.
WRECKED ON A JAPAN ISLAND.; THE SHIP LIZZIE C. TROOP AND MOST OF HER CREW LOST.
THE BALTIMORE DISASTER.; THREE KNOWN TO BE KILLED AND MANY MISSING.

docs.snippet: PORTLAND, Oregon, Dec. 27.--At 1:30 o'clock this morning the Union Pacific steamer Oregon ran into and sunk the British ship Clan McKenzie at Coffin Rock, on the Columbia River. Charles Austin and Matthew Reid, two colored sailors, were instantly ...
docs.lead_paragraph: PORTLAND, Oregon, Dec. 27.--At 1:30 o'clock this morning the Union Pacific steamer Oregon ran into and sunk the British ship Clan McKenzie at Coffin Rock, on the Columbia River. Charles Austin and Matthew Reid, two colored sailors, were instantly killed.

headline.main: A BRITISH SHIP SUNK.; ALL THE CREW SAVED EXCEPT TWO COLORED SAILORS.
